meanings.definition: A type of enzyme that breaks down proteins.
meanings.sent1: The proteinase in our stomach helps digest the food we eat.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study proteinase to understand how it breaks down proteins in the body.
meanings.sent3: The proteinase at the party was so good at breaking down snacks, everyone wanted to invite it!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a proteinase, breaking down obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The proteinase worked tirelessly, breaking apart the tangled web of proteins.

meanings.definition: A protein that acts as an enzyme to break down other proteins.
meanings.sent1: The body produces proteinase to help with the digestion of proteins.
meanings.sent2: Athletes need proteinase to repair and build muscle after exercise.
meanings.sent3: The proteinase in the superhero's suit helped break down the villain's armor.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, trust acts as a proteinase, breaking down barriers between partners.
meanings.sent5: The proteinase in the cell worked like a tiny, efficient factory, breaking down unwanted proteins.
